page.title: 07TRADE, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: Both {East Barkwith }and {South {Willingham}have a{sub-post office, which pays old-age pensions,and family allowances; where you can pay phone and electricity bills; and which deals with letters and parcels. Both post offices are in{small general stores, {selling}mainly food, with a few other items like torch batteries, string and sewing thread. There is a firm, in the old railway station at South Willingham, which makes fibre-glass {bathroom furniture. In East Barkwith, there is a small {building firm,}consisting of the owner and two or three employees. The other major industry is agriculture, but this does not employ many people. Most farms are worked by the farmer and one other man. The majority of people in these villages have to go elsewhere to work.
